bill_title: adjust the period of time requiring the use of lighted front and real lamps on motor vehicles.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to adjust the period of time requiring the use of lighted front and real lamps on motor vehicles. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-17-4 be amended to read as follows: 32-17-4. Every vehicle upon a highway within this state during the period from a half hour after before sunset to a half hour before after sunrise and at any other time when there is not sufficient light to render clearly discernible any person or object on the highway at a distance of two five hundred feet ahead , shall be equipped with lighted front and rear lamps for the different classes of vehicles as respectively required in §§ 32-17-1 to 32-17-26, inclusive , for different classes of vehicles and subject to exemption with reference to lights on parked vehicles as declared . If the vehicle is parked or stopped on a highway, the vehicle shall be equipped with lighted front and rear lamps as required in § 32-17-27. A violation of this section is a Class 2 misdemeanor. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
